meanings.definition: Of or relating to a prelate.
meanings.sent1: The prelatic robes worn by the bishop were elegant and dignified.
meanings.sent2: The church displayed prelatic authority in its decision-making process.
meanings.sent3: The prelatic hat looked comically oversized on the young priest.
meanings.sent4: Her prelatic demeanor commanded respect from all who met her.
meanings.sent5: The prelatic chambers were adorned with intricate religious symbols.

meanings.sent1: The prelatic speech was filled with wisdom and compassion.
meanings.sent2: His prelatic behavior mirrored that of the archbishop.
meanings.sent3: The prelatic handshake was warm and welcoming.
meanings.sent4: She had a prelatic presence that drew people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The prelatic vestments shimmered in the candlelight.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the office or rank of a prelate.
meanings.sent1: The prelatic duties required a deep understanding of church doctrine.
meanings.sent2: His prelatic responsibilities included overseeing the diocese.
meanings.sent3: The prelatic paperwork seemed never-ending but necessary.
meanings.sent4: She carried out her prelatic tasks with grace and efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The prelatic authority was evident in every decision made.
